content.description:
Fantastic route up the proud line of this broad waterfall. Varied, interesting climbing through a vast array of features. The crux is on the third pitch transitioning from the solid ice to the slab which is poorly protected and sometimes rotting out due to sun exposure. 
 Pitch 1: Easy snow, ice and sometimes rock to the base of the steepness. 
 Pitch 2: Starts out easy then quickly changes to steep and sometimes quite technical. 
 Pitch 3: Crux pitch. It is recommended to combine with pitch 2 and quite easily done.

Found about 200 yards downstream from Deliverance. Impossible to miss. Rap the route with double ropes.
Full rack of ice screws. Screw anchor on lower pitches, tree anchor on top.

Pitch 1: Climb easy snow and ice to the base of the steepness. 
 Pitch 2: Move far right to a narrow band of ice. Does not always form. Climb the ice to the same belay ledge as Holey Moley. 
 Pitch 3: Same as for Holey Moley.

Far right hand side. Rap the route with double ropes.
A full rack of screws.

Another stunning line on this classic. More amazing features and great movement on this.  
 Pitch 1: Ascend easy ice, snow and rock to the base of the steepness. 
 Pitch 2: On the right side of the waterfall climb the left facing dihedral up to a ledge where you will find a two bolt anchor. 
 Pitch 3: Move up and left from the anchor diagonally traversing through the slab to the tree anchor. This will usually be the crux as it is often poorly protected and run out.

Full rack of screws. Bolted rap station on pitch 2.
This absolutely stunning 400 foot waterfall makes for one of the best climbs in the province. There are 3 established routes up the wide curtain of ice that offers an amazing amount of variety.
